mdRecord.dcterms:description: The basis of the Cour Carrée is the Louvre Castle, built between 1190 and 1215 by Philip II Augustus to protect the capital from the English. By the 14th century, the castle was well inside the city of Paris, deceasing its defensive value. Francis I (1515–1547) began the transformation of the old castle to a Renaissance palace, with renovations by Pierre Lescot and Jean Goujon. Further additions and renovations carried out under Henri II (1547-1559) and Henri IV (1553-1610). Expansions carried out under Louis XIII by Jacques Lemercier (1624-1636), and under Louis XIV by Louis Le Vau and Claude Perrault (after 1643 to 1668). — https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cour_Carrée [work]
